members.description: The baselinePosition of a NavBar is calculated for the label of the first nav item. If there are no nav items, the NavBar doesn't appear and the baselinePosition is irrelevant.
Name of the the field in the dataProvider object to use as the enabled label.
Name of the field in the dataProvider object to display as the icon for each navigation item.
Name of the field in the dataProvider object to display as the label for each navigation item.

A user-supplied function to run on each item to determine its label. By default, the component looks for a property named label on each data provider item and displays it. However, some data sets do not have a label property nor do they have another property that can be used for displaying. An example is a data set that has lastName and firstName fields but you want to display full names.

You can supply a labelFunction that finds the appropriate fields and returns a displayable string. The labelFunction is also good for handling formatting and localization.

For most components, the label function takes a single argument which is the item in the data provider and returns a String.

\n myLabelFunction(item:Object):String
Index of the active navigation item, where the first item is at an index of 0.
Name of the the field in the dataProvider object to display as the tooltip label.

Returns the string the renderer would display for the given data object based on the labelField and labelFunction properties. If the method cannot convert the parameter to a string, it returns a single space.

values: The string to be displayed based on the data.

members.description: Creates the individual navigator items.  By default, this method performs no action. You can override this method in a subclass to create a navigator item based on the type of navigator items in your subclass.   Typically, this is an icon that you have embedded in the application.

values: label The label for the created navigator item.
icon The icon for the created navigator item.

members.description: Highlights the selected navigator item.  By default, this method performs no action. You can override this method in a subclass to highlight the selected navigator item.  The first item is at an index of 0.

values: index The index of the selected item in the NavBar control.

members.description: Resets the navigator bar to its default state.  By default, this method performs no action. You can override this method in a subclass to reset the navigator bar to a default state.

Sets the label property of a navigator item in the NavBar control.  You can override this method in a subclass to set the label of a navigator item based on the type of navigator items in your subclass.  The first navigator item is at an index of 0.

values: index The index of the navigator item in the NavBar control.
label The new label text for the navigator item.

members.description: Resets the icon of a navigator item in the NavBar control.  You can override this method in a subclass to set the icon of a navigator item based on the type of navigator items in your subclass.  The first navigator item is at an index of 0.  Typically, this is an icon that you have embedded in the application.

values: index The index of the navigator item in the NavBar control.
icon The new icon for the navigator item.

members.description: Handles the MouseEvent.CLICK event for the items in the NavBar control. This handler dispatches the itemClick event for the NavBar control.

events.description: Dispatched when a navigation item is selected.
